replies.msg:
https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/health-environment/article/3111894/hong-kong-tighten-social-distancing-rules-health

She said civil servants were already working from home to some extent, but the government would have to take the lead for the private sector to follow.

“We could be more aggressive and we would have something to tell the civil servants maybe in a day or two about more extensive work from home, or perhaps going back to the toughest period that we have seen,” she said.

https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/health-environment/article/3111894/hong-kong-tighten-social-distancing-rules-health

In an exclusive interview with the Post on Sunday, Chief Executive Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor also revealed that an extensive work-from-home policy for Hong Kong’s 177,000 civil servants would be laid out “in a day or two”, while warning tougher punishments for breaking coronavirus rules were coming.
